content.question: Which of the following explains how the role of government in health care policy would be influenced if the policy proposal in the passage were to be implemented?

choices.label: Because it is a single-payer system, the federal government would be able to cut taxes and still fund health care for everyone in the country.
Due to the nature of the single-payer system, the federal government would provide health care plans only to people who were unable to afford their own plans.
Because it is a single-payer system, the federal government would let private insurance companies take over administering health care plans.
Due to the nature of single-payer health care systems, the federal government would be responsible for funding and administering a public health care system for all citizens.

content.answer: Due to the nature of single-payer health care systems, the federal government would be responsible for funding and administering a public health care system for all citizens.

skill.text: Skill 4.C: Explain how the implications of the argument or perspective in the source may affect political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
